podcast.name: 60-Second Science
podcast.description: Tune in every weekday for quick reports and commentaries on the world of science—it'll just take a minute

podcast_episode.title: A Lifelong Quest to Improve Mental Health Among Cancer Patients [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.name: A Lifelong Quest to Improve Mental Health Among Cancer Patients [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.description: <p>Recognizing those who are making a meaningful impact in the lives of cancer patients, the Cancer Community Awards, sponsored by AstraZeneca, presents an individual or organization with the President’s Award. We reconnected with Margaret Stauffer, the 2021 winner, to hear more about what’s happened since she received the award.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - A Lifelong Quest to Improve Mental Health Among Cancer Patients [Sponsored].

podcast_episode.title: How Next-Generation Sequencing Can Enable Precision Oncology [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.name: How Next-Generation Sequencing Can Enable Precision Oncology [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.description: <p>Celebrating those who enhance the ability to provide the right treatment for the right patient at the right time, the Cancer Community Awards, sponsored by AstraZeneca, presents an individual or organization with the Catalyst for Precision Medicine Award. We prepared for this year’s awards by reconnecting with the 2021 winner, Dr. Colin Pritchard, to hear more about what’s happened since he received the award. </p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - How Next-Generation Sequencing Can Enable Precision Oncology [Sponsored].

podcast_episode.title: Hawking, a Paradox and a Black Hole Mystery, Solved?
podcast_episode.name: Hawking, a Paradox and a Black Hole Mystery, Solved?
podcast_episode.description: <p>We do not have a theory to tell us everything about how a black hole works, but new research is shedding a least some light on one of their many mysteries.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Hawking, a Paradox and a Black Hole Mystery, Solved?.

podcast_episode.title: Monkeypox Update and Homing in on Long COVID: COVID, Quickly, Episode 36
podcast_episode.name: Monkeypox Update and Homing in on Long COVID: COVID, Quickly, Episode 36
podcast_episode.description: <p>On this episode of the <em>COVID, Quickly</em> podcast, we take a few minutes to talk about the other virus making headlines—and then return to long COVID.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Monkeypox Update and Homing in on Long COVID: COVID, Quickly, Episode 36.

podcast_episode.title: Fueling Patients' Drive to Treatment [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.name: Fueling Patients' Drive to Treatment [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.description: <p>Celebrating those who significantly improve access to cancer care for underserved populations, the Cancer Community Awards, sponsored by AstraZeneca, presents an individual or organization with a Catalyst for Change Award. We spoke with the 2021 award winner, Tomma Hargraves, to learn more about what’s happened since she received the award.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Fueling Patients' Drive to Treatment [Sponsored].

podcast_episode.title: Researchers Created a Potion That Turns Loud Lions into Placid Pussycats
podcast_episode.name: Researchers Created a Potion That Turns Loud Lions into Placid Pussycats
podcast_episode.description: <p>A single whiff of oxytocin, a chemical that some call the “love hormone,” promotes tolerance among lions at a wildlife sanctuary.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Researchers Created a Potion That Turns Loud Lions into Placid Pussycats.

podcast_episode.title: Reaching the Root of Disparities in Cancer Care [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.name: Reaching the Root of Disparities in Cancer Care [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.description: <p>Celebrating those who strive to overcome disparities in cancer care to bring quality services to their patients, the Cancer Community Awards, sponsored by AstraZeneca, created the Catalyst for Equity Award. We spoke with Dr. Anne Marie Murphy, executive director of Equal Hope and winner of the award in 2021, to learn more about what’s happened since her organization received the award.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Reaching the Root of Disparities in Cancer Care [Sponsored].

podcast_episode.title: For Some Dolphins, the Key to Mating is Rolling with a Tight, Noisy Crew
podcast_episode.name: For Some Dolphins, the Key to Mating is Rolling with a Tight, Noisy Crew
podcast_episode.description: <p>A pair of studies show that male bottlenose dolphins rely on wingmen when wooing mates—and that they cultivate these friendships by being vocal.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - For Some Dolphins, the Key to Mating is Rolling with a Tight, Noisy Crew.

podcast_episode.title: A Source of Integrative Support for Breast and Ovarian Cancer Patients [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.name: A Source of Integrative Support for Breast and Ovarian Cancer Patients [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.description: <p>Celebrating those who are making a patient’s experience as easy as possible during an extraordinarily difficult time, the Cancer Community Awards, sponsored by AstraZeneca, presents an individual or organization with a Catalyst for Care Award. We spoke with the 2021 winner, Unite for HER’s founder and CEO Sue Weldon, to hear more about what’s happened since her organization received the award.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - A Source of Integrative Support for Breast and Ovarian Cancer Patients [Sponsored].

podcast_episode.title: How Common Are Reinfections? And How Trust Can Beat the Virus: COVID, Quickly, Episode 35
podcast_episode.name: How Common Are Reinfections? And How Trust Can Beat the Virus: COVID, Quickly, Episode 35
podcast_episode.description: <p>On this episode of the COVID, Quickly podcast, we talk about getting reinfected with the coronavirus just a month or two after an earlier bout—and the difference that trusting others can make in a pandemic.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - How Common Are Reinfections? And How Trust Can Beat the Virus: COVID, Quickly, Episode 35.

podcast.name: Plays Well with Others
podcast.description: From Creative Commons, a podcast about the art and science of collaboration. With a focus on the tools, techniques, and mechanics of collaboration, we explore how today's most interesting collaborators are making new things, solving old problems, and getting things done — together. Hosted by Creative Commons CEO Ryan Merkley.

podcast_episode.title: What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?
podcast_episode.name: What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?.m4a

podcast_episode.title: I Laughed So Hard I Cried
podcast_episode.name: I Laughed So Hard I Cried
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - I Laughed So Hard I Cried.m4a

podcast_episode.title: Coming Soon
podcast_episode.name: Coming Soon
podcast_episode.description: <p>From Creative Commons, a new podcast about the art and science of collaboration. With a focus on the tools, techniques, and mechanics of collaboration, we’re going to explore how today's most interesting collaborators are making new things, solving old problems, and getting things done — together. Hosted by Creative Commons CEO Ryan Merkley. Premieres Tuesday, February 19.</p>
